source.2342b353:
The Pearson correlation coefficient measures the linear association between variables. Its value can be interpreted like so:

* +1 - Complete positive correlation
* +0.8 - Strong positive correlation
* +0.6 - Moderate positive correlation
* 0 - no correlation whatsoever
* -0.6 - Moderate negative correlation
* -0.8 - Strong negative correlation
* -1 - Complete negative correlation

(Source: https://stackabuse.com/calculating-pearson-correlation-coefficient-in-python-with-numpy/)

The Pearson correlation between happiness ladder score and GDP per capita is ~0.79. So the answer is yes, it looks like money does make you happy.
